result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Timothy J. Rohr

records.addlTxt: New phone number

10:50 a.m.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  State's 7/19/22 email inducement.
Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed. Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea(s) entered.  Jury calendar.
Scheduling conference:  8/26/22, 10:20 a.m., Br. 1 (this case will be a read in).
Scheduling conference scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 10:20 am.
Scheduling conference on August 26, 2022 at 10:20 am.

1:59 pm - Prosecuting attorney Angelina R Scarpelli in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Timothy J. Rohr in court.  Attorney Michael C Turner appeared by video for Timothy J. Rohr. Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held. Preliminary hearing is set for 07-21-22 at 10:30 a.m. Br. 3.
Preliminary hearing on July 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Notice to defendant.

2:14 pm - Prosecuting attorney Jordan W. Feest in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Timothy J. Rohr not in court.  Attorney Michael C Turner appeared by video for Timothy J. Rohr.  Attorney Turner requests adjournment.  State requests warrant.  Court authorizes warrant, but will hold it until the end of the day.  If the defendant happens to appear for intake yet today, the matter will be reset to 06-27-22 at 1:30 p.m.  If not, the warrant will go out.
3:12 pm - Case recalled.  Defendant has not appeared in person.  Warrant is canceled and matter is reset to 06-27-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 3
Adjourned initial appearance on June 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Attorney Michael Turner is appointed as counsel of record.  Defendant is to reimburse the county at a rate of $50.00 per month commencing 07-01-22.
Initial appearance on June 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

3:14 pm - Prosecuting attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Timothy J. Rohr in court. PFAC filed with the court.  The Court reviews and will appoint counsel.  Initial appearance is set for 06-20-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. .3
Initial appearance scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Prints to TRPD.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody on bench warrant and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.   The matters are continued for initial appearance on 6-6-2022 at 1:30pm in Br. 3.  BAIL FORFEITURE STOPPED. $1,000 cash bond previously set is continued with all prior conditions.  Court orders photos and prints at TRPD.
Bench warrant with service of officer thereon. 
Minutes.
Copies to DA, defendant and Steven Mesna.

3:02 pm - Prosecuting attorney Gail Ann Prost in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Timothy Rohr not appearing. State requests warrant and forfeiture of cash bail.  Court authorizes warrant and forfeiture of cash bail.
Notice to defendant.

2:15 pm - Prosecuting attorney Jordan W. Feest in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Timothy J. Rohr in court. PFAC forms given to defendant to complete and file.
Initial appearance scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Initial appearance on April 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Initial appearance on April 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

2:20 pm - Prosecuting attorney Jordan W. Feest appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Timothy J. Rohr not in court.  When defendant signed his bail bond at the jail, the officer did not indicate the next court date. (see note in file).  The Court instructs the DA's office to mail out summons for defendant to appear for adjourned initial appearance.
Initial appearance scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
RE:  Felony bail jumping as repeater, on 02-27-22.

$1,000.00 cash bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Notice to Party Furnishing Cash Bail.
 - Steven Mesna @ 1916 20th Street, Two Rivers, WI 54241
Order for Prints.
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of felony bail jumping and misdemeanor bail jumping.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 03-07-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 3.  Bail is set at $1,000.00 cash. Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued. Copy filed. Court orders photos and prints at TRPD.
Minutes.
